titleStmt.title: Christus Dei, the Lords annoynted. Or, A theologicall discourse, wherein is proved, that the regall or monarchicall power of our soveraigne lord King Charles is not of humane, but of divine right, and that God is the sole efficient cause thereof, and not the people. Also that every monarch is above the whole common-wealth, and is not onely major singulis, but major vniversis. Written in answer to a late printed pamphlet intituled, Observations upon some of His Majesties late answers and expresses.
titleStmt.author: Jones, John, d. 1660.
Morton, Thomas, 1564-1659.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by His Maiesties command at Oxford [i.e. London],

notesStmt.note: Attributed to John Jones (DNB). Also sometimes attributed to Thomas Morton (NUC).
"A London counterfeit edition, published about March 6, 1642/3, as Thomason received it on March 7" -- Madan.
Annotation on Thomason copy: The "3" crossed out in the imprint date; "March. 7".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
